com.oss.teamwork.teamshare.group
Class Group

java.lang.Object
  com.oss.teamwork.teamshare.group.Group
Direct Known Subclasses:
PublicGroup
public class Group
extends java.lang.Object

The Group entity is defined by an unique ID and its group folder. In addition it holds attributes such as the group owner, its list of users, security keys and settings.

Field Detail

groupID

protected GroupId groupID
The group's unique identifier. It is not visible to users through the application's interface. It is used only internally to identify groups.

folderName

protected Folder folderName
The group folder's name is also the group's actual name. This folder is the root for all the files and folders created by the group's users.

owner

protected User owner
The group's owner.

pendingOwner

protected User pendingOwner
A user that will become the group's owner after an ownership transfer. It is marked as pending only during the transfer.

users

protected java.util.List<User> users
The group's users.

settings

protected java.util.Properties settings
The group's settings. Settings are implementation dependent. Exact settings or their number is not set at domain level. They should include properties such as the maximum number of users and the maximum storage capacity.

version

protected Version version
The (locally-stored) version of the group's folder. Ideally it would be the same for all the devices in the group.

groupSwarm

protected Swarm groupSwarm

Invites an user into the given group.

Invites an external person into the given group.

Parameters:

leave

public void leave()
Starts performing the necessary steps for removing the current user (the logged-in user) from this group.

removeGroup

public void removeGroup()
Removes this group. Can be done only by the owner (the logged-in user must be the group's owner) and only when the group doesn't have any other members.

applyChange

public void applyChange(Change groupChange)
Applies the new group change.

Parameters:
groupChange - - the change that was received for this group from another device(s) in the group
